Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Z
Reviews.Content: Everyone was amazingly friendly from the minute we arrived to the second we pulled away. The rooms are old but kept up. Our phone did not work but they were there in a minute to fix them. I felt safe in the room and the area as the staff is around all of the time. There are not enough parking stalls for all of the rooms so don't bring if vehicle if possible, however, we always found a spot for our car. We will certainly go back if in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: sandy g
Reviews.Content: we are 2 seniors whom certainly have some a lot of travelling we were looking for a reasonably priced place for a couole of nights stay before departing on a cruise ship. The location was great walking distance to many sights. (Walk of Fame, Kodiac Theater, Grauman's) The rooms were very clean, the staff were very helpful and always pleasant, the breakfast was very good and things always clean and fresh. I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “DONN'T BOOK AT THIS HOTEL YOU WILL REGRET IT!”
Reviews.Author: golu12
Reviews.Content: We booked at this hotel in March 2012! What a scary place it is sooo noisy! The hotel is sooooooooooo run down and needs to be closed for maintainance! The AC make so much noise that you cann't sleep all night! Definetly not worth spending the money here at all! Stay in a back packers then this trust me you will regret staying there!

Reviews.Title: “I am treated like family. My favorite place on earth”
Reviews.Author: susieSeattle
Reviews.Content: I am a single woman who travels an average of once a month to various cities. I love this hotel. Kindness and cleanliness .great.. They have taken the time to teach me how to ride metro.. And learn the neighborhood. I have stayed thete for almost 3 years on a regular basis.. I am 50 years old , not dead and ., and spend lots of time just roaming. Ask if u have any questions. They know LA well.. Relax. Play and enjoy.. U will always leave with great memories.. Im going again next month.. I wouldnt dream of staying anywhere else, its like my second home.. Every hotel should be as fun and clean, and safe as this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: EnglishGirl-AngelM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and came back again for 1 more night at the end of our stay in October/November The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The room was well decorated, quiet and exactly what we were looking for. The location is fantastic with easy walking distance to Hollywood Boulevard and around. We'll be returning and happily stay here for every future visit.

Reviews.Title: “NOOOOOO! DON'T DO IT!”
Reviews.Author: Itzyfoxy
Reviews.Content: I would give this a zero if I could.. I just don't understand how it has such good ratings. Not worth $100 p/n. Firstly, the manager was the rudest attendant to ever serve me. We arrived at 11 and asked whether we could check in and were barked at "Where did you get that check-in is at 11? It is at 3 so come back at 3." We asked if we could leave our bags and were told "yes but there are no guarantees". After continous rudeness we decided to cancel our reservation and didn't even make it to see the rooms. Additionally, while we were there we felt that the area was particularly rough and not safe for us to stay in. We felt very uncomfortable. The cashier was barricaded and only had a peep hole. The outside of this place looks like a forgotten old motel and to make matters worse as we were leaving we saw a person in handcuffs getting arrested by the police. I must mention while we were looking for a new hotel, they manager changed his attitude and said we were now able to check in as a room had become available but it was too late. I just wanted to get out of there. Perhaps we had a bad experience and too high expectations but to me the manager was beyond rude and I felt very uncomfortable in the area. If you must stay in Hollywood, we saw Days Inn one block down the road which looked much better.

Reviews.Title: “Scary stuff - don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: J P
Reviews.Content: Not a great stay for us. Our first night of staying here we had kids partying near our room at all hours which kept us wide awake. The same night, someone kept trying to get into our room. We couldn't sleep we were so worried. The next night we had prank phone calls all through the night, and again we couldn't sleep. The management were nice enough, but they just didn't do anything about it. Because the door to your room is outdoors, we just felt unsafe the whole time we were there. Not recommended as a place to stay

Reviews.Title: “I recommend !!!”
Reviews.Author: Redouane B
Reviews.Content: I spent 10 days with my wife there early December, I was a little bit afraid after reading some reviews before I went to this hotel, finally, I totally recommend it to any body who want to stay near Hollywood Blv and it's great attractions, it’s not the Ritz but great for a small Hotel. The location is great, less than 5 minutes walk from Hollywood Blv, Chinese theater, Kodak center… very safe (even if some reviews attesting the opposite!!!). The best thing about this hotel is the service, the Manager always smiling and willing to help if there is any need (even if there is no need he will find something to help you with or at least give you an advice :). The first day we arrived I had an issue with my credit card but the Manager helped us out fixing it and he was very patient with us, he even gave us a discount without us asking him for any thing :) Breakfast is lite and tasty, we always have a parking spot for the car, rooms are very clean and maintained if you have any request. The only negative thing that we may say is that it's a bit noisy the night because of the area, but this is what you get when you want to be in the heart of Hollywood (though it wasn't a big deal to sleep after a long day enjoying LA). We will go back to LA in a couple of months and with no hesitation we’ll go back to this Hotel. I 100% recommend it to any body.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with good service, but don't stray off the main roads”
Reviews.Author: AbbeyFlyer
Reviews.Content: Very small room, noisy and a bit dated but we got a good rate. Breakfast was good and the staff were very helpful throughout our stay. Swimming pool area small and unwelcoming a bit of a furniture store too be honest. Just a short stroll to the Walk of Fame etc. Be careful how you walk back to the Hotel late at night we thought we would take a short cut back from the 'Walk of Fame' which turned out to be a bit dark and scary. Stick to the main roads back to the Hotel and you'll be absolutely fine

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff but the hotel can be very noisy”
Reviews.Author: lsm_dk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in October as part of a round trip in the USA. The staff was very helpful and the people in the reception helped organize transport to some of the attractions that were not in walking distance of the hotel. The hotel itself is in a good location but is somewhat dated. The walls between the rooms are thin and you can here every step that the people in the room above you take. If you have considerate neighbours this however is not a problem but the last night we stayed at the hotel the people above is walked around and was very loud until 3 am so we did not get much sleep that night.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn and Suites Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: mel_emerald
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Comfort Inn and Suites, Hollywood. Located on N Highland Ave, it is a short 5 min walk to the Chinese Theatre and strip. there are lots of restaurants and shopping there and many of the tours depart from around that area. The room itself was very large, clean and perfect for what we needed. the staff were freindly and helpful in booking us tours and giving directions etc. There was daily breakfast which was great, and free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and secure”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireMandy
Reviews.Content: Received a very good welcome on arrival by friendly staff. Room was comfortable, clean and felt secure. Free parking and wifi was a bonus as was tea and coffee making facilities in the room along with a fridge. Highpoint of facility is the excellent shower which is by far the best we've had on this trip. Breakfast was simple but plentiful. The motel is perfectly placed for visiting Hollywood Blvd and the staff extremely efficient in booking tours etc. Well done to the Holiday Inn

Reviews.Title: “Presently Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Meg_baca512
Reviews.Content: I am not a fan of hotels with outside doors, but this one was clean and safe so I was fine. The room were very clean, the bathroom was a good size, huge closet, and good TV. The location is within walking distance to the walk of fame and the Chinese theater, but not close enough to hit up the Sunset Strip bars and clubs by foot. The area is a little shady at night but go down 5 miles and everything looks good again. This hotel was a great price, free parking and breakfast is such a relief, and the location makes it easy to get anywhere by car.

Reviews.Title: “i stayed 5 times but.......”
Reviews.Author: svs8100
Reviews.Content: i stayed there 5 times from september of 2008 to november of 2010. the last time there the cleanliness of the room was bad. they switched me after 2 nights into a 7 night stay, but the cleanliness was poor for both rooms. friendly staff. good area to walk to hollywood blvd. during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and great location....”
Reviews.Author: shortcakeMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This is the second year running that I have stayed at this property both times have been fantastic. The Manager is a lovely man full of info and the hotel is in a great location if you want to see the sights on Hollywood as it is within walking distance to Hollywood Walk of Fame. Rooms are generous and clean with a fridge and coffee maker. WiFi, parking and breakfast is included in the room rate which is basic but more than sufficient. I have no hesitation in recommending this property and would return yet again especially for price and location.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel and has an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: monymontana
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located in the heart of the sunset Blvd, simply 3 mins walking and your are infront of the kodak theater,the famous Hollywood stars walk and virgin mega store, the rooms are very nice and comfortable not huge but the size was just ok, the hotel has also a small swimming pool and you have a free parking just in front of your rooms,the staff was more than nice and helpful especially the Indian gentleman, he will guide you around and offer you all info you ask for couldn't been happier with the service,the location is just amazing really you are surrounded by shops plazas restaurants you really name it, we rented a car which was a very cheap rate and everything seems pretty close and easy really, it is a good base to go all around Hollywood and surroundings area, i totally recommend this hotel and will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Best time ever!”
Reviews.Author: Katie197522
Reviews.Content: Was here for 10 days and it was AMAZING! The hotel was very clean which is so important to me and my friends. The staff is very well trained and very helpful. Everything you could want to do in LA is within walking distance basically so the location is perfect. I cannot wait to go back! Thanks for a great time! : ))

Reviews.Title: “Great location & clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: FleurDeLis1222
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been renamed "Comfort Inn Near Hollywood Walk of Fame." While staying there, my husband and I had a wonderful & comfortable stay. Breakfast consisted of pastries, bread, bananas, oranges, & a waffle iron w/ fresh batter. It was good, but we could have used some protein. Our biggest complaint was that the wifi was a little spotty. I really needed to send some important emails for work, so I walked across the street to the public library & used one of their libraries for free. Problem solved! The hotel was also a decent walk to the Walk of Fame, Chinese Theater, & Disney Soda Shop. Overall, we felt very safe & I was very happy with the rate that we paid. The bed was comfortable & our hotel's window faced a large empty lot on the side of the building, which I prefer to windows that face the walkway. I'd definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location but be carefully with hot water...”
Reviews.Author: 55chicos
Reviews.Content: the price is average and the room was very nice. just 2 long block uphill from hollywood boulevard and very short drive to universal studios. again the room was great, the shower the water control handle for the hot water was tricky. you have to just time it right.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there no matter what”
Reviews.Author: fartrip
Reviews.Content: You could see through the door to outside cars and people. Window was open almost to street level and you could hear everything. Did not get any sleep because it was loud and on the sketchie side. Staff was not at all friendly or helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Everything”
Reviews.Author: cardiology
Reviews.Content: We chose at this motel while visiting Los Angeles because it was close to the sights of Hollywood. We did not realize at the time that the actual neighborhood was a little seedy but we always felt safe. The motel was clean, offered a nice free breakfast (although the breakfast area was quite small) and the rooms were adequate size with flat screen TV. It had a pool that looked clean but we did not use it. There is parking on site although the spaces are small. The people who ran the motel were very nice and extremely accommodating to our requests - they even allowed us to keep our car parked there after check-out so we could go back to see some sights we missed. I would recommend this motel if you are looking for a clean place to spend a few days while in the Hollywood area. It is basic but the cost was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel in the heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: clairescottish
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this budget hotel with my partner for two weeks. Originally, we had only booked one week at the place but we liked it so much we extended our stay for the full holiday! This is a budget hotel - don't stay here if you're used to luxury and want somewhere really fancy. The room we stayed in was clean and tidy, there was a daily maid service where our bed sheets were changed, new towels were provided and the bathroom was given a spruce. We had two standard doubles at the back of the hotel next to the pool and it was quiet at night, the air conditioning system worked fine and despite what some reviewers mentioned our carpets were fine! There is free breakfast provided, complete with cereal, fruit, hot beverages, pastries and doughnuts, english muffins and toast - the best part is the waffle maker! The eating area is a little cramped, but my partner and I were able to sit and eat breakfast every day for the full two week visit. The hotel is very centrally located for Hollywood. There is free parking and if you don't drive (like us) the bus stop is 20 seconds away. Hollywood Boulevard is less than 5 minutes walk and all the Hollywood sights are a stone's throw away. The staff were incredibly helpful and courteous - I'd recommend them above anything else! They were able to help with public transport queries, booking shuttles for us, general chat and advice about all and sundry. They even matched online rates for us on the second week and gave us a great deal. There is also a small swimming pool at the back of the hotel, which looked fine to me but I didn't take a dip. Other travellers did go for a swim and they seemed happy enough! High speed internet is also available - there is wireless in the reception area and we had an ethernet cable in the room which was speedy and reliable. This is a fab little location for budget travellers or for anyone looking for somewhere clean and safe to lay their head after a full day's holiday in the city. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Backpacker level accommodation – but we extended our stay.”
Reviews.Author: L0ve2Fish
Reviews.Content: CHECKIN – Anisur gave a warm welcome & put us in rooms on 3rd floor. All guests we saw left smiling. I understand there may be a friends & family rate if you are staying again. ROOM – compact, tired & not the cleanest. We checked out other options but decided to extend our stay due to location & price. King bed in small room. Possibly their laundry isn’t the best as the beds in both rooms we stayed in had several hairs in - I’m assuming they changed the sheets. They have tried to modernise the rooms but they are a little rough around edges (patched doors, drafty windows, mould). EXTRAS - TV needs 2 remotes & some patience to operate. You will need to plug your laptop in to use the internet. Breakfast includes waffles, toast, bagels & donuts in a very small space so be prepared to wait. LOCATION – 1 block from Walk of Stars. Great for public transport. Very central to attractions. Santa Monica / Venice Beach are pricey & most hotels are a bus ride from beach & several transfers elsewhere. Don’t stay in City as there is nothing to do. Airport & South are seedy & unsafe at night. Lot of derelicts wandering about. Untidy, rough, slums abound. Sales people are sleazy. Gangsters talk very loudly on their phones – obviously trying to impress. FOOD – great Chinese @ Le Oriental Bistro (good value also). Make sure you try In N Out burgers on corner – tasty & well priced - no wonder they are so busy. Hollywood a Great Ending Bar across the road is actually quite nice inside. TRANSIT - $6 day pass is a good option as you will need to get a number of connecting buses to get to Santa Monica / Venice Beach. Our subway tickets were never checked – I don’t know why they don’t use the turnstiles. Do NOT get a weekly transport pass as these run Sun-Sat & need to be validated in town. Avoid taking a shuttle to the airport around rush hour – even if you’ve told them what time you need to be there they may take a couple of hours driving round trying to fill the van. BEST things about this hotel are its manager Anisur, the location & price. Suitable if you are on a budget & using public transport.

Reviews.Title: “BLACK MOLD! DIRTY AND UNSAFE- MANAGEMENT DOESN'T CARE!”
Reviews.Author: hlv79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Comfort Inn Near the Sunset Strip in March 2011. We thought it would be a bargain in a great location, but as the old saying goes, you get what you pay for. Do NOT stay here unless you would enjoy experiencing what we did: 1.) BLACK MOLD. Need I say more? My husband and I both broke out in horrible rashes and the management refused to even look at the room and acknowledge or rectify the problem! 2.) STRONG MOLD / MILDEW SMELL. See point 1, above. 3.) BROKEN SECURITY LOCKS. This hotel (actually it is a MOTEL) is located at one of the busiest intersections and ANYONE can walk up to the rooms. Furthermore, the property is not very well lit. If you enjoy feeling safe, look for accommodation elsewhere. 4.) DIRTY ROOMS WITH BROKEN FURNITURE. Do you like black socks? Lumpy, flat pillows that feel as though they have been used for the past ten years by countless strangers? Cracked / damaged furniture that looks as though they have been in numerous bar brawls? If not, again, look elsewhere. (I've noticed other reviews mentioning 'black socks' from walking on the carpets-- we can also attest that this is true.) I could go on, but do I actually need to? Complaints to both the hotel management and Choice Hotels International were met with a generic response-- in other words, THEY DO NOT CARE. So, if you actually think you might get lucky and get a bargain, you might want to think twice and remember our experience...

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but noisy”
Reviews.Author: mikeinlamesa
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nicer than I had been expecting but the hotels location on Sunset and LaBrea made for a lot of noise especially after the clubs closed. To be fair, a lot of the people making noise were in my group but this may not be the best place for a good nights sleep on any night of the week.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not great”
Reviews.Author: barrkm1996
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mainly because of the location. The hotel was easy to find and the staff were quite nice. The continental breakfast was really nice. Having a waffle maker was really nice. The room was okay, but nothing great. The bedspread had a patch on it and the room didn't seem very clean. The price was okay for what you got. I would recommend it if you are traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice front desk clerk, great location, walking distance to sights, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: WinchesterCouple
Reviews.Content: Anisur, our front desk manager was very helpful and provided us with excellent service. Rooms are nicely decorated, flat screen TV's and all staff were very friendly. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: Kayo22
Reviews.Content: If you want a place to hang your hat for a few days (9 in my case) this is a decent place. The rooms are small but if you are just there to sleep they're okay. It truly is only a couple of blocks to the biggest attractions on HW Blvd. I ate breakfst in my room because of the size of the "dining room". I was promised internet access but only had it 4 hours out of 9 days. The rugs are dirty because I had the black sock experience, too. The house keeping is the worst of all the places I've stayed in CA. My room was not made up for 4 of the 9 days I was there until after 4. 2 of those days after 5. I never got the same abount of room comps (soap, coffee, etc.) 2 days in a row. I never got any for 2 days. If you don't expect too much then this is the place to go. I recommend Pasadena Comfort Inn and drive in.

Reviews.Title: “Agrivating from the 1st min.”
Reviews.Author: entrophia
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerk made us wait 45 min because the room wasn't clean and he said they had 2 housekeepers cleaning it. I felt like it was caotic. We got to the room and the bathroom floor wasn't clean so I found old contacts on it. The front desk didn't tell me when breakfast was or where the room was he just gave me keys with the room number. During the 45 min of waiting he told us about all the hotels problems and brought his cigarette into the lobby. When we checked out we left an expensive pillow in the room but when we came back to get it 1hr later housekeeping had our pillow case in the trash and had claimed my pillow as their own. I know for a fact hotels are to give you 30 days to claim your forgotten things.

Reviews.Title: “awesome value”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina F
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the W hotel on Hollywood, the Regency Century Plaza in Bev Hills, and was a bit skeptical about staying here. I did not have high expectations. It was perfect. I booked this hotel for the free parking, free breakfast, central location & great price. It was exactly what I wanted. The breakfast was good (waffles, fruit, pastries - which we often grabbed a couple for on the road), if cramped. Good coffee too, come to think of it. The ease of coming & going as we wished, perfect. Our room was clean (with maybe one 'ew' - stained ironing board, who cares, move on) the beds were super comfy, bathroom was small but clean & nice. Small fridge in the room too, perfect if you hit up the grocery store for more cheap snacks...or wine ;) The lcoation can NOT be beat (unless you're looking for seaside), super central to SO much. Minutes to Burbank & Universal. I've just booked another stay @ a Comfort Inn hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.....”
Reviews.Author: 604tinkoo
Reviews.Content: I didn't book this my self so hear me out. Don't be fooled by the good ratings. This hotel is rated 80%+, BUT this is the rating for a 2-star hotel. Well i should say MOTEL because that's exactly what it is. We checked in at night and to tell you the truth it was kinda creepy simply parking the car and walking to the room. Rooms are small but have been furnished to look better than a 2 star and I see that they are trying hard to move up half a star but there is work to be done! -Ants everywhere in the bathroom. Night staff was friendly but unable to change our rooms. We were provided with a can of bug spray. -Bathtub did not drain which was a pain. Plumber attended late the next day. -Carpets are EXTREMELY DIRTY! My socks turned black after being in the room for less than 5 minutes! (response from management was that it had been raining and he cant help it if people wear dirty shoes inside. YES HE CAN HELP, CLEAN THE DAMN CARPETS!) THis would explain the musty smell Didn't use the pool or even see where it was but I probably wouldn't use it. Didn't eat at the free breakfast area but it was the size of a walk in closet. We checked out the next day and refused to pay for the first night. The manager was a little rude but agreed and we moved to the Grafton on Sunset. I don't enjoy dirty motels or motel style accommodations. I would NOT stay here or recommend it even though the location is ideal for walking to attractions. (I HAD PICTURES TO PROVE ALL I WROTE ON MY IPHONE BUT ALL WAS LOST WHEN I HAD IT REPAIRED)

Reviews.Title: “Good location but with problems.”
Reviews.Author: Techboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on Sunset Bvld but it's actually very close to the Walk of Fame. The metro is 7-10 minute walk which is where the Walk of Fame is also. The room I was in was spacious with a fridge but no microwave. There is a communal microwave in the lounge/lobby. Also the method to access the TV is very strange/different. There are homeless people around but it didn't bother me as they just mind their own business and you will also see them on the metro. The breakfast area is tiny and has the usual assortment of items. Lots of restaurants and shops around so finding a place to eat shouldn't be a problem. It can be noisy so if you're a light sleeper it might be a problem. No free computer to use but there is an pricey Internet cafe around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “I liked this place and wanted to write a review that would give travellers all the information I wanted before booking.”
Reviews.Author: deanrogue
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife for five days in October 2010. When we travel, I like things to be perfect, so I took the time to read several reviews about this place. Most of them were positive so I booked it. When we arrived at the hotel (which was easy to find using our GPS), the first thing I noticed was that Sunset Blvd. was a busy street, and that made getting in and out of the parking lot a bit tiresome. The parking spaces are small and limited, but we had no trouble with parking. The hotel was smaller and less polished than I anticipated (more like a three story motel). The Manager (Anisur) allowed us to check-in about an hour and a half early, which was a big help. The staff was always friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable but the carpet needed cleaning. We walked about the room in our socks and within 2 minutes they were visibly dirty. Breakfast was good - a nice variety of things to choose from, but the breakfast area is small and can feel congested if more than eight people are there at one time. The hotel is located within walking distance of eating places and other amenities (7-eleven, Rite-aid, iHop, Starbucks, Burger King etc.), and about 7-10 minutes walk to Hollywood Blvd. When we stayed there, they were doing road work out front so we had a couple noisy nights to contend with, but that's temporary. The neighborhood seemed relatively safe, but I wouldn't let kids run around by themselves. All in all, this was a good choice for the price. Don't expect a three star hotel and you'll enjoy your stay. The manager and staff realize that their hotel is small and can't compete with the more affluent places, so they do a great job trying to accommodate their guests and make them feel at home. And sometimes that's way better than those snooty/stuffy places.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable and close to walk of fame”
Reviews.Author: mainiac04631
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, out their way service, continetal breakfast with waffles, within walking distance to most areas and not a bad neighborhood. many fast food restaurant in the area only last regual restaraunts but that is ok if you don't mind a less than mile walk

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best.”
Reviews.Author: zebrasky
Reviews.Content: Stay 2 nights at this property at the beginning of Oct. 2010. It would appear that the rooms were recently remodeled however, nothing great. The hotel is “Average at best". The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. If you are on a budget, this is a good hotel. The property if just blocks from Hollywood Blvd. The rooms are tired. There is only so much you can do with an older hotel. The rooms were clean and the bathroom was O.K. it would have been better if there was an electrical outlet in there. There is Internet, however, its not wirelrss, but the cable is in the room. Pool is small but clean. There is also free parking and thats an added bonus in Hollywood. The breakfast area is very small and the food items were average. As I stated in my title, this is an average hotel. No frills and I would probably stay here again if need be.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced. Like all of Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: youkillemwechillem
Reviews.Content: The desk staff were friendly enough but they were the only ones who could speak English! In keeping with much of Hollywood, this hotel is over priced and the location isn't great. We travelled over 2500 miles across America and this is the only place where we didnt feel safe. Maybe i'm being overly critical, but i just didnt like Hollywood at all. A mile up the road in Beverly Hills is great but i definately wouldn't go back to the Sunset Strip. All hype and not really a nice place to be, unless you want drugs, prostitutes, a tattoo, or a gun to shoot someone! This hotel (as with most in the area) cost the same per night as staying in the Mandalay Bay in Vegas! If you must visit Hollywood, dont let the words "Sunset Strip" or "Hollywood Boulevard" convince you that you'll be getting a nice hotel. You won't! There aren't any nice hotels within about a mile of Hollywood Boulevard or the Sunset Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a nice price”
Reviews.Author: postalsteve
Reviews.Content: Older hotel with small rooms,not the cleanest place but no bugs or odors. Bathroom was very dimly lit, floor got wet when using the sink,plenty of hot water. Free breakfast including waffles in lobby. Lobby had only 2 tables,always overcrowded. No evening dining but plenty of eateries right by hotel. Seemed to be a safe area. Internet access. Very tight parking, but it was free which is great feature often overlooked. Air worked well. Very friendly staff. Did not use the pool but it looked clean. Only 5 minute walk to the walk of fame, 10min. to hollywood bowl, 15min. to pantages theatre. No shuttles but short drive to universal,movie studios,dodgers. No fitness center, but I ran sunset & hollywood blvd. every morning which was really cool. As a gov. employee I found a great rate at choice hotels. This is a no frills hotel. If you plan on sightseeing all day and need a quiet place to sleep this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Malicette78
Reviews.Content: Helpful and very nice staff trying to solve our problem as if it was their problem; they asked spontaneously the price of our shuttle from the airport, and offered us to call one less expensive for our way back to the airport. Bedroom was clean, well situated for the walk of Fame. Sweet very nice breakfast but a small lobby (only 12 people can have breakfast at the same time so it can be a problem for large groups).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jamers526
Reviews.Content: Excellent modern hotel with knowledgeable and friendly staff. Great Bathroom & walk in closet with King Bed and flat screen TV. Walked to the Hollywood Bowl for concert and was in a convenient location to everything you would want to see in Hollywood! They offered discounts while we were there for the LA City Tours and we took advantage of that. We were provided a shuttle and got to tour the city at a discounted rate! Will stay here next time!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs.....”
Reviews.Author: Dynamite2010
Reviews.Content: Probably I would give this hotel 3 points, but since i got bitten 20 (!!!) times, all over my body, by bedbugs the first night I stayed there, I just feel that 2/5 are enough. First of all, positive things about this Comfort Inn: good location (but just because Walk Of Fame, Kodak Theater, ... are within walking distance. The neighborhood isn't that great), free WiFi, free parking. The first night we stayed there (I don't remember the room number, but we were on the second floor), we got into our room and we were like WOW, it's pretty hot in here, even hotter than outside (90F). So we logically turned on the AC, but that thing wasn't working. We were too tired to ask for a room change, so we tried to survive. It took us hours to fall asleep, and when we woke up, I got a beautiful surprise. I got bitten by bedbugs, 20 bites all over my body. After more than 2 weeks, I still have marks on my body cause of those bites. We immediately changed room, and everything was okay then. AC was working, the new room looked way cleaner, and I didn't get bitten anymore. If you're not allergic to bedbugs bites, you'll probably "like" this average-class motel/hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Town”
Reviews.Author: tripo9
Reviews.Content: I have know word for this hotel and staff, they are the best... Free parking in Hollywood, Amazing...

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: lincolnpark89178
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to LA. We were not happy with the last hotel we stayed at. But, after our stay here we know where to stay everytime we come back. The facility was in a PERFECT location, free parking, and the desk staff was AMAZING! They have someone at the front desk 24/7 so if you need anything and they have a view of who comes in and out of the parking lot. The rooms are updated and look amazing for an older hotel. Beds were comfortable our room had a walk in closet. I was pleased and so was my husband! Best hotle for price and location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Super Location”
Reviews.Author: rce9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on Sunset/LaBrea. Great location there were plenty of restaurants nearby. The room were clean and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast was super made my own waffle. Hotel staff was extremely helpful. Internet was a bit slow at times, have a pool, no jacuzzi. Still for the price and location I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: altermood
Reviews.Content: King-sized bed (which was huge), internet connection (free), flat screen tv, parking, great front desk service, swimming pool, location near everything...and to top it off, a great price. I was pleasantly surprised with this place. When I booked it, I was thinking that it might turn out to be another sleazy hollywood motel because I know the area. I used to live a block away from this place but never paid it much attention when I lived in the area (I don't think it was the comfort inn at that time, either). Everyone at the front desk were so nice and accommodating. We were out in L.A. for a family function and the next day, my aunt drove out and parked in the parking lot because parking in Hollywood is pretty bad. The hotel only allows one car in the lot and I was worried about it getting towed while both cars (we had a rental) were there before we went out and when we came back. I explained the situation at the front desk and they were like "don't worry about it". There were a bunch of spaces open at the time so I guess it wasn't that big of a deal, but a lot of people could have been adamant about the one-car rule. It was a great stay and I would recommend this place to anyone coming to L.A. that needs an affordable place to stay that is near the major sights (the walk of fame is two blocks away).

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: JQI
Reviews.Content: A good value hotel (especially given free parking) in a central location. We enjoyed the treat of waffles and cakes for breakfast on the first day but something a bit lighter would have been nice after that! Also very little space for breakfast so often had to stand or perch on the edge of someone else's table. Other than that, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy area, yet has some pluses.”
Reviews.Author: onley1
Reviews.Content: I actually reserved the room via the hotel's website. I got a better deal that way. Plus side...perfect location if you are looking to stay within the Hollywood area. You are near LaBrea and one of the side streets Orange Ave will get you to Hollywood Blvd in a 10 minute walk. It's not necessarily a cheap hotel. I spent an avg of $110 per night. Yet, you get free parking. It's on Sunset Blvd, and it's quite a busy street, so you will find yourself turning right most of the time, but you can drive down side streets and those are never as busy. The rooms were clean, and beds were ok in comfort. A fews things annoyed me...many of the people who stayed there slammed their doors. The bathroom has a shower curtain that is very thin, and water sprays out onto the floor, so I recommend that you hang your clothes and not put them near the floor. The bathoom becomes quite the sauna. The walls are thin, so you can hear your neighbors next door and above. The continental breakfast was ok. It is a very small area, so get up early if you want to sit and eat your breakfast in peace. There are some restaurants nearby...IHOP, Starbucks, Subway, Pollo Loco, and In/Out Burger. We stayed there for about 6 nights, and after the second night...I somewhat wished I had booked somewhere else. It was just too long to stay there. It's ok for a weekend in LA...but staying there for a long period...hearing all the slamming doors...it gets to be annoying. Plus, there is a bar across the street and it has people lined up on Saturday nights. It an get rather loud if your room is close to the street.

Reviews.Title: “A basic clean hotel at a reasonable price in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: 2seniorcitizens
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel were basic but very clean and included a small fridge. We ate an early breakfast in the room that doubles as office and eating area but only 2 tables. The manager was exceptionally friendly and accomodating, booked tours for us, and offered information about the area. The parking was adequate (and free!) and we had a pleasant stay with no problems. If you're looking for a clean reasonable place to stay in Hollywood near all the attractions, you can book this hotel with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “I set my hopes too high”
Reviews.Author: RobinDede
Reviews.Content: Prior reviews on TripAdvisor helped me set my expectations a little high for this hotel. The room was nice - enough space, very clean, and decent amenities. I was less pleased with the front desk experience, space for continental breakfast, and the horrible smoky smells. I very much appreciate that California hotels are smoke free but somehow, our hotel wreaked of smoke both nights of our stay. Of course, by morning, we were accustomed to it and no longer noticed; but, leave and go site seeing then come back. The seating area for the continental breakfast only accomodated about people. My family was 7 so we had to eat our breakfast in shifts or take plates to our room. The day of our departure, I had to knock on the door of the lobby at 6 am to check out. The location is nice. We liked being able to walk to Hollywood Blvd and see the sites without the hassle of driving, parking or getting a cab. And, even beng on Sunset Blvd, the traffic noise wasn't as bad as I'd expected. In the end, this was the highest price hotel on our trip to California yet the least of what I'd hoped for. For the price, I really expected more.

Reviews.Title: “this place is a dump!!”
Reviews.Author: Hellojojo
Reviews.Content: This place is a real gem in the gutter... Do not be deceived by photos, the buiding looks about 100 yrs old, the carpet is cheap, the feel of the place is like a refurbished old county building. also the hotel is located in a shady looking neighborhood. the "minimalist" look is just a cover for cheapness. the bathroom was small, cramped and musty. The only bonus about the room is that the furniture is new but it's all from Ikea. i felt dirty staying here. never again.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Beach_Baby
Reviews.Content: very disappointed with our stay. rooms are very small and cramped! and the whole time we stayed (one night-thank God!) we can smell pot especially if we open the bathroom door. the pool is very small and doesn't look clean. i was not brave enough to use it.. we stayed on the main floor level and we can hear people walking around on the room upstairs.....soundproofing doesn't exist on this hotel..... also we paid cash upon check out and they put hold on our credit card for over 2 weeks! after being told that our credit card wasn't charged!!!! very misleading!

Reviews.Title: “Insecured”
Reviews.Author: Nunupatel
Reviews.Content: No secuirity guy Open parking/no gate Homeless & Prostitutes are all around. Gangs in front of 7/11 Extremely busy traffic -hard to get out & in. Cramped parking lot Swimming pool water has not been changed ever since these gujus take over Manager has double roll- selling room & selling tours Poor breakfast- so called continental! Bed bug ANTS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “clean safe and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: JUICE&BRUDY
Reviews.Content: October 2009. 3 nigths in this no frills but clean and safe hotel with city parking on site was a pleasant surprise. Desk staff extremely helpful. Free breaky to get you started . 2 blocks from Walk of fame and shopping. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “General Manager of the motel is very nice”
Reviews.Author: mrullah
Reviews.Content: The General Manager of the motel is very nice. His name is Mr. Anisur Rahman Badal(ex-paralegal). He is tall, handsome and very good looking. Everybody including the maids love him. He started his carrier as a cashier and within few years they made him GM. Only problem is that he provokes guests to buy tour programs. He does everything. He cleans restroom, makes bed, count cash etc. When I met him first ,he was cleaning the owners car ( a black FX35). Cangratulations Badal. One day you will be the owner of this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Good management, good location, I liked this motel.”
Reviews.Author: NatureBagUser
Reviews.Content: This motel is well managed and within a comfortable walk of the Hollywood tourist places on Hollywood Blvd. Our room was a bit cramped with its king size bed, but comfortable enough for the 2 of us. It was clean and nicely appointed. The evening manager who checked us in was a college student, very friendly and eager to please. The day manager was the same and had lots of helpful information. The included breakfast was good and had something I had never seen before: a do-it-yourself waffle maker. The breakfast area was clean and the manager tidied up after each guest was finished, replenishing the food supplies. The only negative was that the wireless internet did not work during the night, and I thought we were being put off when we were told that the outage was due to wildfires that had plagued the area earlier in the week, but that the problem was being corrected. In the morning, the system was up, and the manager showed me a log of calls he had placed in the preceding week to the service provider attempting to get service restored.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: bjagall
Reviews.Content: Yes have to agree that the hotel is in a good location, however some unsavoury characters everywhere you look. The hotel claims to be 100% smoke free but found ashtrays everywhere?!?! The small pool area was covered in cigarette ends which was another turn off. Breakfast was very basic but set you up for the day ahead. All in all the rooms were nice and clean and nicely finished so would ....... maybe stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel for good location and good manager”
Reviews.Author: Ritakhiani
Reviews.Content: Hi, I am from new york i stayed in comfort inn on sunset blvd:for 5 days i have to dropp my Younger daughter to USC college so we were looking for hotel which has good location so my son can go any where to walking distance i couldn't ask better than this hotel it is perfect to walk in 5 minutes to most famous places, and the Manager of the hotel is so nice helpful kind very few people are like him.His name is Anisur and i met the owners wife they are indians but very kind and always ask me if she can help me anyway so kind.Rooms were i think newly renoveted and the cleaning staff was very nice. Overall we enjoyed staying there i was with my there children they liked the hotel and the location .Thankyou manager Anisur.We were on 3rd floor so we didnot heard any noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “perfect because of the manager,he was great !”
Reviews.Author: gabriela63
Reviews.Content: thanks to mister anizur,he made my stay in the comfort inn very comfortable.... congrats, gabriela and his family

Reviews.Title: “good service, nice room, nice position”
Reviews.Author: avisintini
Reviews.Content: well positioned if you wan to visit hollywood and the studios, nice room better than expections, employees very kind, concierge guy (indian) more than available. breakfast a bit poor.

Reviews.Title: “Best option in this neighbourhoood”
Reviews.Author: TheSentinel
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here very much. The owner was very informative and helpful. Free cranberry juice and orange juice all day. Free LAN internet with speed of around 60kbps which worked fine. Less than 5 minutes walk to the walk of fame. Could also walk to Roxy / Rodeo Drive area (about 40 mins). The room was a decent size. Free parking. Big TV.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of Good A little bit of Bad”
Reviews.Author: Rails81
Reviews.Content: We drove into Hollywood with no plan, just wanted to find a good well priced Hotel close to all the sights. We entered the Comfort Inn on sunset greeted by a very helpful and pleasant Indian man. We booked the room for 3 night an off we went. Rooms are a good size, nice comfy bed heaps of cupboard space for all your stuff. We just could figure out why once we had showered and tucked up in bed why our feet were so black and filthy. At first I though because we were walking so much maybe the dye in out shoes had run? Nope it was just the filthy carpet...yuk, i don't think it had ever been cleaned. I glad we worked this out on our last night there! All the things you want to see are within walking distance, Kodak theater / walk of fame lots of great restaurants and night life. We easily got the subway straight to universal studios and had a good day out. We were even instructed by the friendly man the Hotel counter that Rodeo Drive was only an 8 block walk. Easy... So with directions in hand we headed off. Unfortunately for us the directions were incorrect and after walking for around 2 hours we managed to hail a cab and take the 20min drive to rodeo drive. Would recommend, very convenient everything else (except the carpet) was clean, just keep your shoes on!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value, Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: mark_SydNSW
Reviews.Content: The location is great – a 5-10 minute walk to Hollywood Boulevard, 10 minutes to a train station for easy access to Universal Studios and downtown LA, and round the corner there’s a bus route that goes to the La Brea tar pits. There are also a lot of cheap eating options within a 5 minute walk, and an internet cafe across the street. The staff were friendly and helpful with directions and advice. When our group got separated they made calls to international mobiles for us – at no charge. The rooms have recently been renovated – they have good facilities and are clean and comfortable. The breakfast bar is free and well stocked (the staff keep replenishing it during the morning) – there were 7 people in our group and there was something for everyone. It was a great timesaver for us at the start of each day. We stayed there 3 nights and everyone was very happy with it. It was great value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Customer Service and position to Hollywod Walk of Fame”
Reviews.Author: Lorette53
Reviews.Content: Only 2 blocks from Hollywood Walk of Fame ( where movie premiers are shown- saw Wil Ferrell) Sunset Boulevarde goes straight into Beverley Hills past all nightclubs and restaurants. Great customer service. Ashwir on the front desk helped with tours, which picked us up from hotel. The best Hollywood Homes Tour, soo funny and informative, lots of inside information. Also around the corner from LA INK Ashwir also had time one morning to cook our waffles for breakfast - yum. Thanks Ashwir, I would recommend this hotel for anyone, who wants location, service and comfort and free parking - too easy

Reviews.Title: “great hotel all new and in the right spot and right price”
Reviews.Author: jeanie16
Reviews.Content: room had just been refurbished i was the first to rent it. the staff went out of their way to help me at all times. the happy ending bar across the road was fantastic every night. and i could walk to hollywood boulevard in ten min. it is a great location great staff and free car parking. it was the best deal i have ever had in u.s.a i have been a lot of times. and intend to go to the hotel on my next trip

Reviews.Title: “Good value, recently refurbished”
Reviews.Author: Hagauer
Reviews.Content: Modern rooms (flatscreen TV - this is Hollywood, after all!), rather quiet even if close to Sunset Boulevard, convenient location, good breakfast (included), friendly staff, good value for money. Very fast cable hookups (no WiFi)

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: crhodes370
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from March 13-15, 2009. Our room was facing Sunset Blvd., which gave us a great feel for Hollywood. It was the best thing about the room. The shower would only provide hot water when the handle was tugged and pushed and tugged some more. Management was notified but nothing was done. There was a refrigerator--just no outlet available to plug it in. Because the room was close to the street and the stairs, it was noisier than most. As we are both sound sleepers, it did not bother us, but if you are not, it might. The room wasn't dirty but wasn't particularly clean either. There was a flat screen tv but the picture was a bit blurry. The breakfast consisted of 2 choices of cereal or waffles. Our second morning there, when I was checking out, the manager started yelling at me, something about reporting complaints directly to him, and he was sorry I did not sleep well. I think he had me confused with someone else as I did sleep well and the noise did not bother me but his heavily accented tirade was still very unpleasant. It is for this lack of customer care that I would not recommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaNeano
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very convenient, off the Hollywood Blvd. Directly on the Sunset Strip though, so noise in the front room was noticeable, with cars and sirens going by at night. Although the hotel on the outside looked old, the room was newly remodeled and queen beds were very comfortable. We stayed in a room with a pull out sofa bed, and that was very uncomfortable. The other negative was our shower, which didn't have very much pressure, and the vanity which was quite narrow. The room itself was spacious and comfortable. Overall, this room worked out very well for us (4 adults in one room). The breakfast seating area was small but the breakfast itself was great. They did a very good job of keeping it resupplied and full. The front desk staff was friendly. The "empty lot" mentioned in previous posts was fenced off. We felt safe staying here and walked wherever we needed to go, even at night.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jools20
Reviews.Content: This was a very well located and priced hotel. The staff were not that chatty but they were not rude either, they could of given us more info at times. A smile and warm welcome would of made it 5 stars for service for me. The rooms were well equipped but they didnt top up our coffee every day and there was a table in our room that took up alot of space. We didnt have a safe in our room and also we couldnt connect to the free internet with any of our or our friends devices. We did notice some ants the morning we left along the top of our bath so cleanliness is 4 stars. If you are a light sleeper you may want to stay further out of town as I could imagine it can be noisy (this doesn't effect me as nothing wakes me!) However I would stay here again as the location and price is really good and my negative points are really not that bad. The free breakfast was perfect with lots on offer and we had free parking right outside our room.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated & good facilities”
Reviews.Author: krjohnson1973
Reviews.Content: We wanted some accommodation in LA that was reasonably priced, clean and had facilities nearby and this hotel was absolutely ideal. Only 5-10 minutes walk to the Kodak Theatre and the Walk Of Fame and between the hotel and there is Hollywood High School (where Grease was filmed!) The rooms are a reasonable size and very clean with plenty of storage space and nice decor. We never had problems getting a parking space but most of them were full by late afternoon so there might be issues if you are getting back later at night. Although the hotel is on Sunset Boulevard, it is actually 26 miles long so if there is something particular on Sunset you want to be near then check its location! If you are wanting to be near Sunset Strip for Whiskey A-gogo, Viper Room etc. then it's about 10 minutes drive from the hotel and about $15 by cab. There are loads of facilities nearby such as Burger King, Subway, IHOP, Wendys and other restaurants - our favourite was Wing Stop....delicious! There is a bar a couple of minutes away and others within 5 minutes walk. To be honest not many people go to LA to spend much time in the city but if you want somewhere handy, clean and competitively priced then this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of the Sunset”
Reviews.Author: EverybodysACritic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this small hotel only one night. We were a little leery staying here because of the reviews we had read, but, after reading the entry on TripAdvisor from the person who stayed here in October 2008, we thought we would give it a try. We were pleasantly surprised! The staff were friendly and when we needed directions (without using the freeway) to our destination for that evening, he said he would print them and we told him we would pick them up on our way out. In no time flat they were printed and he had brought them to our door! Great service. The room was a little small and the beds were only doubles (kindof small for two adults), but, it was comfortable. The furniture was nice and there was a flat screen tv on the wall. The room appeared to have been renovated recently. The bathroom was an ok size. The whole room was clean. We always wipe down every hotel room with anitibacterial wipes as soon as we arrive, and this room was no exception. In most every hotel we have ever stayed, even 4 and 5 star ones, the wipes are black when we are finished. This room totally passed the "white glove" test. This was a surprise, but, says alot about the cleaning crew and owners of the hotel. Good Job! There are only two negatives I have regarding this hotel. There are not many parking spots, so, if you have a late evening, you may not get one when you return. The parking spots are small. We had trouble fitting our SUV into one. The other one is the bathroom window would not lock, so, it was easily opened. There were bars on the window, so, even with the window unlocked, we felt safe. I would definately recommend this hotel to all travellers. The staff are nice, It is clean and moderately priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ebburtner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights during our spring break. I was somewhat leary on staying here after reading some of the bad reviews. This hotel was VERY nice! The rooms were VERY clean. We stayed in a double room which was a little small but nice. Nice flat screen tvs on the walls, nice beds and furniture. Even had a walk in closet in the room. The towels and washclothes were VERY nice. I was very impressed with the rooms. The breakfast area was small but we just went down for coffee and thats it. The parking lot was a little tight but we didn't have any problems with that. We didn't use the pool because it wasn't warm enough outside at this time of year. Overall, I was very impressed! The hotel staff was extremely friendly too!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not great”
Reviews.Author: Welbudj1
Reviews.Content: The location is fine for walking to the Walk of Fame area but it's a little scruffy and needs some attention. The hotel is clean enough and surprisingly quiet considering it's on a main road, but the breakfast area is way too small for the numbers of people that were eating. The internet cafe across the road is handy and car parking is available which is a necessity. We didn't use the pool so I can't comment on that. Not bad for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for walking”
Reviews.Author: SWWAGlobetrekker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July for three nights to see the sights in Hollywood and the Comfort Inn is in easy walking distance to Graumens and the Kodak Theater and the Hollywood walk of fame. The staff is exceptional on sending you in the right direction to find anything you need to see. The rooms are re-done and had a flat screen TV and new furnishings. The bathroom had a older smell, but understandable being an older place that had renovation. The only thing negative is the parking, it is difficult to get in and get out because the lot is so narrow. Also getting in and out of the hotel was difficult with the traffic but it is best just to part and walk. All in all the place is good for families who want to be close to the action.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the rough”
Reviews.Author: waytra
Reviews.Content: This hotel has just undergone a renovation and it is a lovely hotel. The room was clean and comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful. It is close to eating places and shopping. It's a shame about the general area, we felt intimidated as we walked around the block, to the point that my wife said she was scared to stay in the area. I suppose when you see bars on every window in the area, you have to wonder. We ended up leaving after one night and going to stay in Disneyland. However, the hotel deserves a huge thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: kori
Reviews.Content: The check-in and the check-out were quick and friendly. We had a room with a king-sized bed and the room was small, especially the area between the end of the bed and the TV/refer unit is very narrow. The room was clean with new furniture. The bathroom was clean and looked like most of it was recently remodeled. The breakfast room is very small and so is the selection of breakfast items. The motel is located in easy walking distance of Hollywood Blvd and Kodak Theater. Parking is tight, but free, and we didn't have a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget Motel”
Reviews.Author: erinP16
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister for 6 nights in March. Such a great location on Sunset Blvd and easy walk to Hollywood Blvd. Ralphs supermarket is just down the road too. Staff were very friendly and offered advice and tips on what to do and how to get around. Rooms are very modern and clean - couldnt fault it. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, and close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Guatemalantraveler
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Los Angeles airport at 2 am, with no hotel reservations at all. All hotels near the airport were full. I saw their number at the airport, and they were friendly since the beginning, they advised me how to get a 20 dollars shuttle instead of the taxi I was planning to take. It took 20 minutes to get there from the airport. Even though it was 2.30 am when I arrived the staff was friendly and helpfull. I was charged $ 200.00 for two nights. Next morning I was amazed to see the great location it was. Two blocks away from the Chinese Theatre, the Kodak Theatre, and the Metro station. Next door from the hotel you can find a Starbucks cafe and a little shopping mall, with a cafe internet, a convenience store, even a ROSS store. IHOP is close as well, At night you can take a two dollar bus in front of the hotel that drives you in minutes to the Sunset Strip. Exellent choice, if you go to L.A. to see Hollywood and party in the Sunset Strip with a tight budget. Also the rooms looked new and very clean. On the downside the pool looked dirty and too close to the parking lot, but I was pleased to stay there, the staff made me feel at home, and I will stay there on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Served purpose”
Reviews.Author: adcantor
Reviews.Content: One of my friends had his first film up for best drama and best female actress, so we went down (6 guys) as his entourage. We stayed for 4 nights, and found the bathrooms recently updated and nice; we all commented on the shower heads (excellent). The rooms were very clean. There is no view whatsoever from the third (or any floor), but you are close to everything, so who cares. We were happy to be there for grammy night, and saw a bunch of celebrities during our trip. Hollywood itself was kinda gross and dissapointing - a lot of hype (as mentioned in previous reviews), but we are not talking about hollywood; we are talking about the travelodge. The only complaint I have is the breakfast. If you want it, get up early. And you better like doughnuts, 'cause that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Worth checking out if you want a convenient place to rest your head.”
Reviews.Author: SuthoSydney
Reviews.Content: This place is so convenient to Hollywood and all its sights. The rooms have been recently renovated, we stayed in 2 adjacent rooms – our teenage girls in one. The rooms were very clean, but the A/C was noisy. It was reasonably priced, the ‘continental breakfast’ was not worth having. A 7-11 across the road was handy for snacks and there are plenty of places to eat within a short distance. It was what we wanted, a base close to all the action – so we were happy. Value for money? – not sure, but worth checking out if you want a convenient place to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “Yuk”
Reviews.Author: capejoy
Reviews.Content: We had thought it would be a fun idea to stay in Hollywood but we were wrong. It is dirty and downmarket. We arrived in town without a booking and found there was a convention on and most of the accommodation was taken. We found the Travel Lodge on Sunset Boulevard and thought it would be of the same standard as our Travel Lodges in England. It is not. The room was very basic, dark and gloomy although it was clean. No hairdryer or iron/board in the room but Reception would let you have one if you asked. In our case we needed to iron but they had no ironing board to go with it. The air conditioning was too noisy for sleep and the whole place looked as if it could do with being refurbished. The breakfast which was included in the price amounted to donuts from the 7/11 opposite and they had the cheek to charge a premium rate because of the convention in town. Steer clear.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: barbiegirl
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge is a great base for a short stay in LA. We stayed for just one night in September 2005 having visited Universal for the day and before heading to Sea World in San Diego. Great value for money and ideal for those with a car.

Reviews.Title: “decent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the rooms are dated.. but very clean. and the bed was comfortable. My friend and i stayed at this Hotel for a weekend Oct. 05. We paid $67.00 a night with a AAA/CAA discount. They offer a small continental breakfast that we never took advantage of, but there is also a star bucks right next door :) I had my laptop there, and i didn't find a wireless connection as the previous review states. But i could connect to Starbucks wireless net if i had wanted to. and there is an internet cafe right across the street that is cheap if you really need a connection. there was a little noise at night, but that is to be expected when staying right on Sunset Blvd not far from the walk of fame, and the hollywood and highland complex. Nothing that a pair of ear plugs can't fix. i would stay at this hotel again.. i am frequently in the LA area, and i am sure i will end up at this hotel again :)

Reviews.Title: “Only if you cant afford anything better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my first review here ever. I travel so much in a year and have used this site ofr info that I thought it was time to give someting back. Well my first review is not going to be a nice one. We stayed here New Years Eve night because everything else in the area was expensive at last minute. Luckly we planned on a better hotel the next night (The Bel Age). We paid $79, not bad compared to everything else, but you get what you paid for. The motel was full and parking was extremly limited. The room was clean but very worn. I didnt get any internet service as a previous writer mentioned. The worst thing was NO HOT WATER! Actually it couldnt have been colder. I asked for help from the front desk and was told there were no rooms to move and what did I expect him to do for me. Clearly he didnt care. What he should have told me was C = Hot and H = cold. I guess I could have tried that myself. But again if your on a budget and dont care, then this is a clean room with a bed.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Westumbria
Reviews.Content: This hotel is super simple. It is clearly 1950s with some modest renovations. The actual room was adequate and very clean. I was able to use my laptop as they seem to have a free wireless internet connection for the guests. The pool was quite small and cold, but very clean. Doughnuts and coffee are on offer in the morning. My only complaint about this hotel is that the price is a bit high for the area and there is a lack of security. It is possible to access the hotel by several different doors and none seem to be closely monitored by the hotel staff, but my room did have double locks. What more, the hotel's location is in an area that seems to be on the margins of tourist Hollywood and a run down residential area with a liquor store on the corner.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn Near the Sunset Strip
HotelInfo.Address: 7051 Sunset Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90028 (Formerly Travelodge Sunset La Brea)
